meanings.definition: To pay back money to someone who has spent it
meanings.sent1: She is reimbursing her friend for the movie tickets.
meanings.sent2: The company will be reimbursing employees for travel expenses.
meanings.sent3: John felt relieved after reimbursing his sister for the borrowed cash.
meanings.sent4: The act of reimbursing felt like returning a favor in kind.
meanings.sent5: Reimbursing promptly can strengthen trust in relationships.

meanings.sent1: The insurance company is reimbursing the medical costs.
meanings.sent2: The school will be reimbursing students for the canceled trip.
meanings.sent3: The idea of reimbursing all the spent money made them smile.
meanings.sent4: Reimbursing the losses felt like a weight lifted off their shoulders.
meanings.sent5: Reimbursing fairly is essential for customer satisfaction.
